content: The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence for health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence within the Department of Veterans Affairs for the prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a Center of Excellence within the Department of Veterans Affairs to study, diagnose, and treat health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures. The selection of the site for the center will consider entities with specialized equipment and a track record of publishing information on post-deployment health exposures among veterans. The Center of Excellence established by the "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" will collaborate with various entities to study and treat health conditions related to exposure to burn pits. It will have access to models of dust immunology and lung injury, expertise in allergy, immunology, and pulmonary diseases, and will be responsible for developing, testing, and providing treatments. The Center of Excellence established by the "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" will provide guidance for the health systems of the Department and the Department of Defense in determining personnel required for quality healthcare for members of the Armed Forces and veterans with health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and other environmental exposures. It will also establish a comprehensive program to train health professionals in treating these conditions. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" aims to advance the study of short-term and long-term effects of exposure to burn pits and other environmental factors, disseminate best practices for training health professionals, conduct research on related health conditions, and provide medical treatment to veterans diagnosed with specific conditions from exposure to burn pits. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" establishes a center of excellence to study the health effects of exposure to burn pits and other environmental factors. The center will utilize data from the burn pits registry and define a burn pit as an area in Afghanistan or Iraq used for burning solid waste in the open air without specialized equipment. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" authorizes funding of $4,100,000 for five fiscal years to study health effects of exposure to burn pits and other environmental hazards in Afghanistan or Iraq. Additional funding may be awarded for research purposes on a competitive basis. The "Helping Veterans Exposed to Burn Pits Act" authorizes funding for research on health effects of exposure to burn pits and environmental hazards in Afghanistan or Iraq. A new section is added for clinical and scientific investigation under chapter 73 of the title. Center of excellence for prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of health conditions related to exposure to burn pits and environmental hazards.
